title: How to Make Colcannon

steps.headline: Fill a large pot with water.
steps.description: Add the potatoes with salted cold water and cover. Simmer for 15 minutes, or until tender.

steps.headline: Pour the cream into a small saucepan.
steps.description: Heat it up to be warm but not boiling. Add the 4 tablespoons of butter, one teaspoon of black pepper, half a teaspoon of salt, the crushed garlic and the bay leaf. Strain before adding to the mashed potatoes.

steps.headline: In another large pot, heat 2 to 3 tablespoons of butter.
steps.description: Add the onion and sauté until it becomes translucent. Then, add the cabbage and spring onions. Stir well. Cover, then steam the cabbage mixture in the butter for 5 to 10 minutes. Remove the lid from the pot every minute to toss the ingredients and to check their tenderness. Remove from heat once tender.

steps.headline: Remove the potatoes from the heat.
steps.description: Drain in a colander. Put them into the intended serving bowl and mash well.

steps.headline: Once mashed, pour in the strained hot cream mixture.
steps.description: Whisk the mashed potatoes and cream mixture together until creamy.

steps.headline: Finally, add the cabbage mixture.
steps.description: Season to taste. It is ready for serving; if you wish to keep it warm, be sure to use a container with a lid and that retains heat.

text: Fill a large pot with water. Add the potatoes with salted cold water and cover. Simmer for 15 minutes, or until tender. Pour the cream into a small saucepan. Heat it up to be warm but not boiling. Add the 4 tablespoons of butter, one teaspoon of black pepper, half a teaspoon of salt, the crushed garlic and the bay leaf. Strain before adding to the mashed potatoes. In another large pot, heat 2 to 3 tablespoons of butter. Add the onion and sauté until it becomes translucent. Then, add the cabbage and spring onions. Stir well. Cover, then steam the cabbage mixture in the butter for 5 to 10 minutes. Remove the lid from the pot every minute to toss the ingredients and to check their tenderness. Remove from heat once tender. Remove the potatoes from the heat. Drain in a colander. Put them into the intended serving bowl and mash well. Once mashed, pour in the strained hot cream mixture. Whisk the mashed potatoes and cream mixture together until creamy. Finally, add the cabbage mixture. Season to taste. It is ready for serving; if you wish to keep it warm, be sure to use a container with a lid and that retains heat.
